title: Provide only summary + truncated listing in error and warnings for `get`
body:
It just keeps flooding my screen, hiding away previous warnings and errors.
Instead of 

```
[WARNING] could not get some content in /mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openneuro/ds000241 [u'/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openneuro/ds000241/derivatives/mriqc/T1w.csv', u'/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openneuro/ds000241/derivatives/mriqc/bold.csv', u'/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openneuro/ds000241/derivatives/mriqc/reports/sub-00_task-ak6_run-01_bold.html', u'/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openneuro/ds000241/derivatives/mriqc/reports/sub-00_task-ak6_run-03_bold.html', u'/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openneuro/ds000241/derivatives/mriqc/reports/sub-00_task-ak6_run-02_bold.html', u'/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openneuro/ds000241/derivatives/mriqc/reports/bold_group.html', u'/mnt/btrfs/datasets/da...
```
we should report

```
[WARNING] could not get some content in 1023 files:  /mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/op....
```

and instead of the flood ( I think we might have an issue on that already) of
```
[ERROR  ] from s3-PUBLIC...; Unable to access these remotes: s3-PUBLIC; Try making some of these repositories available:; 	8f89a624-8f2b-4037-808d-116691c9ec85 -- [s3-PUBLIC];  	a4d3451b-6689-400c-84fc-59ae36719dd6 -- root@2964ce471527:/datalad/ds000241; ; (Note that these git remotes have annex-ignore set: origin) [get(/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openneuro/ds000241/sub-11/func/sub-11_task-ak6_run-10_bold.nii.gz)] 
[ERROR  ] from s3-PUBLIC...; Unable to access these remotes: s3-PUBLIC; Try making some of these repositories available:; 	8f89a624-8f2b-4037-808d-116691c9ec85 -- [s3-PUBLIC];  	a4d3451b-6689-400c-84fc-59ae36719dd6 -- root@2964ce471527:/datalad/ds000241; ; (Note that these git remotes have annex-ignore set: origin) [get(/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openneuro/ds000241/sub-11/func/sub-11_task-ak6_run-09_bold.nii.gz)] 
```
we should come up with a way to summarize and provide a meaningful description that following remotes should be enabled to provide access to X files.  Or just report a single ERROR (per dataset) stating that there may be more, and advise to consule `git annex where` or smth like that
